headline: Data types
text.1: The circles in this graphic represent the different data types a company collects and shares. Each circle represents one data type. The size of each circle represents the number of times this datatype is shared with other companies.
text.2: Sharing information is a key element of the current data economy. Some of that sharing is needed, useful, and in the best interest of the user as well (e.g. to protect you against credit card fraud). But not all of it is. Often data is gathered and shared that does not correspond to your interests at all. By far the most common interest served by sharing your data is advertising.
